content.question:
Scientists are studying several populations of finches on neighboring islands in the South Pacific. Previous genetic analysis has shown that a single gene controls tail-feather length in the finch populations and that the allele for long tail feathers <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaiikaiaadYeacaGGPaaaaa@381E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is dominant to the allele for short tail feathers <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaiikaiaadYgacaGGPaaaaa@383E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. On two separate islands, the scientists recorded the number of finches with long tail feathers and the number of finches with short tail feathers. The results are shown in the table below.

If the two finch populations are each in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium and are isolated from each other, then which of the following graphs correctly displays the relative genotype frequencies?

choices.label: Each answer, each option shows a bar graph with the horizontal axis labeled Genotype and the vertical axis labeled Frequency.  There are 3 sets of 2 bars each labeled, from left to right, uppercase L uppercase L, uppercase L lowercase l, and lowercase l lowercase l.  In each set of bars, the bar with lighter shading represents Island 1, and the bar with darker shading represents Island 2. The vertical axis has evenly spaced lines numbered 0 through 0.6,in increments of 0.1.  The bars are as follows:uppercase L uppercase L: Island 1, 0.45; Island 2, 0.3.uppercase L lowercase l: Island 1, 0.43; Island 2, 0.5.lowercase l lowercase l: Island 1, 0.1; Island 2, 0.2

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
